NodeIteratorNextNode.summary:
The NodeIterator.nextNode() method returns the next node
in the set represented by the and advances the position of
the iterator within the set. The first call to nextNode() returns the
first node in the set.

remarks.para: This method returns null when there are no nodes left in the set.

In old browsers, as specified in old versions of the specifications, the method may
throws the INVALID_STATE_ERR if this method
is called after the method. Recent browsers never
throw.

NodeIteratorNextNode.returns: A representing the node after the current node in the set represented by this NodeIterator, or null if the current node is the last node in the set.
